data.title: Former members of the London Assembly
data.meta_description: Information on former members of the London Assembly
data.text:
Jennette Arnold OBE

Labour Party

Constituency: Hackney, Islington and Waltham Forest

Elected in May 2000. Served as Assembly Member until March 2021.

During her time as a London Assembly Member, Jennette Arnold's responsibilities included:

Chair of the London Assembly

Chair of the Education Panel

Member of the Police and Crime Committee

Member of the Environment Committee

Tony Arbour

Conservative Party

Constituency: Hounslow, Kingston upon Thames and Richmond upon Thames

Elected in May 2000. Served as Assembly Member until March 2021.

During his time as a London Assembly Member, Tony Arbour's responsibilities included:

Chairman of the London Assembly

Member of the Environment Committee

Member of the Fire, Resilience and Emergency Planning Committee

Member of the Police & Crime Committee

Member of the Education Panel

Gareth Bacon MP

Conservative Party

Constituency: Bexley and Bromley

Gareth Bacon was elected in 2008 as a Londonwide Assembly Member, and was re-elected in 2016 as the Assembly Member for Bexley and Bromley. Served as Assembly Member until March 2021.

During his time as a London Assembly Member, Gareth Bacon's responsibilities included:

Chair of the Budget & Performance Committee

Chair of LFEPA

Andrew Dismore

Labour Party

Constituency: Barnet and Camden

Served as Assembly Member until March 2021.

During his time as a London Assembly Member, Andrew Dismore's responsibilities included:

Chair of the Fire, Resilience and Emergency Planning Committee

Member of the Police and Crime Committee

Nicky Gavron

Labour Party

Constituency: Londonwide

Served as Assembly Member until March 2021.

During her time as a London Assembly Member, Nicky Gavron's responsibilities included:

Statutory Deputy Mayor of London

Deputy Chair of the Planning and Regeneration Committee

Member of the Environment Committee

Member of the Housing Committee

Navin Shah

Labour Party

Constituency: Brent and Harrow

Served as Assembly Member until March 2021.

During his time as a London Assembly Member, Navin Shah's responsibilities included:

Chair of the London Assembly

Member of the Confirmation Hearings Committee

Member of the GLA Oversight Committee

Member of the Planning and Regeneration Committee

Member of the Transport Committee

Steve O'Connell

Conservative Party

Constituency: Croydon and Sutton

Elected in May 2008. Served as Assembly Member until March 2021.

During his time as a London Assembly Member, Steve O'Connell's responsibilities included:

Chairman of the Police and Crime Committee

Florence Eshalomi MP

Labour Party

Constituency: Lambeth and Southwark

Elected in May 2016. Served as Assembly Member until March 2021.

During her time as a London Assembly Member, Florence Eshalomi's responsibilities included:

Chair of the Transport Committee

Peter Whittle

Brexit Alliance Group

Constituency: Londonwide

Elected in May 2016. Served as Assembly Member until March 2021.

During his time as a London Assembly Member, Peter Whittle's responsibilities included:

Member of the Confirmation Hearings Committee

Member of the GLA Oversight Committee

Member of the Police and Crime Committee

Member of the EU Exit Working Group

Member of the Devolution Working Group

Member of the Standing Orders Working Group

Member of the Chief Officer Performance Review Panel

David Kurten

Brexit Alliance Group

Constituency: Londonwide

Elected in May 2016. Served as Assembly Member until March 2021.

During his time as a London Assembly Member, David Kurten's responsibilities included:

Member of the Environment Committee

Member of the Fire, Resilience and Emergency Planning Committee

Member of the Housing Committee

Member of the Transport Committee

Member of the Education Panel

Dr Fiona Twycross

Labour Party

Constituency: Londonwide

Elected in May 2012 and re-elected in May 2016: served as Assembly Member until March 2020.

Responsibilities

During her time as a London Assembly Member, Fiona Twycross’s responsibilities included:

Deputy Mayor for Fire and Resilience

Chair and Deputy Chair of the London Fire and Emergency Planning Authority

Chair of the London Resilience Forum

Chief Resilience Officer

Chair and Member of the Economy Committee

Member of the Education Panel

Member of the Health Committee

Member of the Regeneration Committee

Member of the Audit Panel

Member of the Health and Environment Committee

Member of the Housing Committee

Member of the Housing and Regeneration Committee

Member of the Police and Crime Committee

Member of the Thames Passenger Boat Investigation Committee

Tom Copley

Labour Party

Constituency: Londonwide

Elected in May 2012 and re-elected in May 2016: served as Assembly Member until March 2020.

Responsibilties

During his time as a London Assembly Member, Tom Copley’s responsibilities included:

Chair, Deputy Chair and Member of the Housing Committee

Chair of the Garden Bridge Working Group

Housing spokesperson for the Labour Group

Member of the Confirmation Hearings Committee

Member of the GLA Oversight Committee

Member of the Transport Committee

Member of the Planning Committee

Member of the Economy Committee

Member of the Audit Panel

Member of the Budget Monitoring Sub Committee

Member of the Education Panel

Member of the Housing and Regeneration Committee

Member of the London Fire and Emergency Planning Authority

James Cleverly MP

Conservative Party

Constituency: Bexley and Bromley

Elected on 5 May 2008; served as Assembly Member until May 2016.

Responsibilities

During his time as a London Assembly Member, James Cleverly’s responsibilities included:

Member of the Metropolitan Police Authority

Member of the London Development Agency

Mayor’s Youth Ambassador

Chairman of the London Waste and Recycling Board

Leader of the Conservative Group on the London Assembly

Member of the Regeneration Committee

Member of the Environment Committee

Chairman of the London Fire and Emergency Planning Authority

Chairman of the London Local Resilience Forum

Kit Malthouse MP

Conservative Party

Constituency: West Central (Hammersmith & Fulham, Kensington and Chelsea, City of Westminster)

Elected on 6 May 2008; served as Assembly Member and retired at the May 2016 elections.

Responsibilities

During his time as an Assembly Member, Kit Malthouse’s responsibilities included:

Chairman of the Metropolitan Police Authority

Statutory Deputy Mayor for Policing & Crime

Deputy Mayor for Business & Enterprise

Member of the Economy Committee

Member of the Health Committee

Member of the Planning Committee

Member of the Standards Committee

Chairman of Hydrogen London

Co-chairman of the London Enterprise Partnership

Board member of TheCityUK and HyER (European Association for Hydrogen and fuel cells and Electro-mobility)

Board member of London & Partners (promotional body for London)

Board member of the Association of Police Authorities

Board member of the London Regional Resilience Forum

Richard Tracey

Conservative Party

Constituency: Merton and Wandsworth

Elected in May 2008; re-elected in May 2012 and retired at the May 2016 elections.

Passed away in March 2020.

Responsibilities

During his time as an Assembly Member, Richard Tracey's responsibilities included:

Mayoral Special Appointment

Mayor's Ambassador for River Transport

Chairman of the London Waste and Recycling Board (2012 - 2016)

Deputy leader of the Conservative Group (2010 - 2016)

Conservative lead on Transport and Conservative Transport spokesman (2008 - 2016)

Member of the Budget Committee (2008 - 2016)

Vice Chairman of LFEPA (2010 - 2012)

Member of the Metropolitan Police Authority (2008 - 2010)

Roger Evans

Conservative Party

Constituency: London Borough of Havering & Redbridge

Elected on 4 May 2000; served as Assembly Member and retired at the May 2016 elections.

Responsibilities

During his time as an Assembly Member, Roger Evans’s responsibilities included:

Statutory Deputy Mayor of London (13 May 2015-6 May 2016, replacing Victoria Borwick who had been elected to parliament)

President of the Home & Water Safety Council

Chairman of the London Assembly

Conservative spokesman for Transport

Chairman of the Transport Committee

Deputy Chairman of the Audit Panel

Conservative spokesman for Police and Crime

Member of the Police and Crime Committee

Member of the GLA Oversight Committee

Member of the Budget & Performance Committee

Member of the Housing & Regeneration Committee

Member of the Committee of Regions (CoR) European Parliament

Member of Trust for London Foundation

Board Member of the London Thames Gateway Development Corporation Board.

Jenny Jones

Green Party

Constituency: Londonwide

Elected on 2 May 2000 and re-elected on 10 June 2004, 1 May 2008 and 3 May 2012; served as an Assembly Member until May 2016.

Responsibilities

During her time as a London Assembly Member, Jenny Jones' responsibilities included:

Deputy Mayor of London

Chair of the London Food Board

Chair of the Economy Committee

Chair of the Planning and Housing Committee

Member of the Metropolitan Police Authority

Darren Johnson

Green Party

Constituency: Londonwide

Elected on 2 May 2000 and re-elected on 10 June 2004, 1 May 2008 and 3 May 2012; served as an Assembly Member until May 2016.

Responsibilities

During his time as a London Assembly Member, Darren Johnson's responsibilities included:

Chair of the London Assembly

Chair of the Housing Committee

Chair of the Environment Committee

Member of the London Fire and Emergency Planning Authority

Stephen Knight

Liberal Democrat Party

Constituency: Londonwide

Elected on 3 May 2012; served as Assembly Member until May 2016.

Responsibilities

During his time as a London Assembly Member, Stephen Knight's responsibilities included:

Chair (2013-14) & Deputy Chair of the Assembly Economy Committee

Deputy Chair of the Assembly Budget & Performance Committee

Member of the Assembly Housing Committee

Chair (2014-15) & Member of the Assembly Environment Committee

Member of the London Fire and Emergency Planning Authority

Murad Qureshi

Labour Party

Constituency: London-wide

Elected in 2004; served until May 2016.

Responsibilities

During his time as a London Assembly Member, Murad Qureshi's responsibilities included:

Deputy Chair of the Environment Committee

Chair of London Waterways Commission

Member of the Economy Committee

Member of Health Committee

Member of Heathrow Airport Consultative Committee (HACC)

Member of the Transport Committee

John Biggs

Labour Party

Constituency: City & East London

Elected in May 2000; served until May 2016. Elected Mayor of Tower Hamlets June 2015

Responsibilities

During his time as a London Assembly Member, John Biggs’ responsibilities included:

Chair of Budget & Performance Committee

Chair of Budget Monitoring Sub Committee

Chair of Audit Panel

Member of Regeneration Committee

Member of Transport Committee

Member of Planning & Spatial Development Committee

Member of Police & Crime Committee (former Chair)

Member of Economic Development, Culture, Sport & Tourism Committee

Member of the Metropolitan Police Authority (MPA)

Member of London Fire & Emergency Planning Authority (LFEPA)

Vice Chair London Development Agency (LDA)

Deputy Chair London Thames Gateway Development Corporation (LTGDC)

Deputy Member of Chamber of Local Authorities in Europe (CLRAE)

Valerie Shawcross CBE

Labour Party

Constituency: Lambeth & Southwark

Elected in May 2000; served until May 2016

Responsibilities

During her time as a London Assembly Member, Valerie Shawcross’ responsibilities included:

Chair of London Fire & Emergency Planning Authority (2000 – 2008)

Chair of Transport Committee

Chair of Audit Panel

Chair of Senior performance review panel

Member of Budget & Performance Committee

Member of Budget Monitoring Sub-Committee

Member of Health Committee

Member of GLA Oversight Committee

Member of Economy Committee

Member of Planning & Spatial Development Committee

Member of Metropolitan Police Authority

Green Party

Constituency: Londonwide

Elected on 4 May 2000; served as Assembly Member until March 2003.

Responsibilities

During his time as a London Assembly Member, Victor Anderson's responsibilities included:

Member of London Sustainable Development Commission

Board member of London Waste Action

Cabinet Adviser to the Mayor on Environmental Issues

Board member of the London Development Agency

Member of Assembly Culture, Sport and Tourism Committee

Member of Assembly Budget Committee

Member of Assembly Audit Panel

British National Party

Constituency: Londonwide

Elected on 1 May 2008; served as an Assembly Member until May 2012.

Responsibilities

During his time as a London Assembly Member, Richard Barnbook’s responsibilities included:

Conservative Party

Constituency: Ealing and Hillingdon

Responsibilities
